<<<<<<< HEAD
Indecorum: or A briefe treatise vpon one of Salomons Prouerbs. Chap 11.22 Wherein is shewed, how ill-beseeming all common gifts and worldly blessings are to all such, as are not furnished with some answerable measure, of spirituall and sauing grace. Egerton, Stephen, 1555?-1621?
[44], 179, 190-196, [6] p.
Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for Richard Boyle [and VVilliam Ihones], and are to be sould at his shop dwelling in the Blackefriers, At London : 1613.
Heading of dedication, and "To the Christian reader" at end, signed: S.E., i.e. Stephen Egerton. Running title reads: A briefe treatise vpon Prouerbs, 11.22. Colophon reads: Printed at London by Felix Kingston for Richard Boyle, and VVilliam Ihones. 1613. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======

[44], 179, 190-196, [6] p.
Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for Richard Boyle [and VVilliam Ihones], and are to be sould at his shop dwelling in the Blackefriers, At London : 1613.
Heading of dedication, and "To the Christian reader" at end, signed: S.E., i.e. Stephen Egerton. Running title reads: A briefe treatise vpon Prouerbs, 11.22. Colophon reads: Printed at London by Felix Kingston for Richard Boyle, and VVilliam Ihones. 1613. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
